result.execSummary:
The defendant Cullen Landon Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cullen Landon Scott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cullen Landon Scott was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Cullen Landon Scott was found guilty of Possession or Use of Marijauna. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today September 26, 2016 by 11:00 a.m.
Defenant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file and balance of $584.50 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CM87.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CM87.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CM87.

-Complete treatment including aftercare.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Fleet Farm in Hudson WI.
-Apology letter within 30 days.
-Restorative Justice Program.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-Send in applications for college this week.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  Barbara K Miller   DF:  S=Cullen Landon Scott appeared. Case called at 9:39 am. Victim Rights have been complied with. ADA Anderson recites agreement. Recess. Case recalled at 9:49 am. Court amends Count #6 to County Ordinance #59.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #1 and No Contest to amended Count #6.  Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #1 and amended Count #6. Court reads in and dismisses Counts #2 - #5 for purposes of restitution. Parties make sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. On Count #1, Court orders 1 yr probation w/h with conditions - 
- 45 Days Jail STAYED

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  with any Fleet Farm.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Gina Gross, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Matthew Hartung, Cullen Landon Scott pro se.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading.  Defendant wishes to proceed with out an attorney and represent himself. Court enters NG.  Reserves speedy trial.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
